column4: hey channel, pulled out a box i had on my shelf for a few months, fired it up....forgot the root password....there something easier then reinstalling? it's a 300/96, hate to loose 2 hrs to install..
boot into recovery mode (also, ubuntu doesn't have a root password by default, and using one is discouraged)
you can find recovery mode in your GRUB menu, which shows up if you hit Esc just before the boot process starts
there you can change your password with the "passwd" command
